Hi Mikkel,

I'm glad you brought this up since a number of others have run =
into
this problem lately, and it would be nice if we can finally have a
con=
sensus on how to solve it.

The problem is that I used to compile NEAT in g=
cc 2.9.5, which did not
require namespaces to be specified directly.  Now, =
however, in gcc 3
or above, you have to specify the namespace.

In other wo=
rds, any declarations using the STL now have to use fully
qualified names. =
 STL is now only in the std:: namespace so
*theoretically* you need to chan=
ge every STL object from <object> to
<std::object>.

However, you can actua=
lly get it to work by adding "using std;" to the
top of each source file.

=
Let me know how far this gets you....if more problems come up please
post t=
hem so we can work together to get things working, as I am sure
it will be =
helpful for others using higher versions of gcc or Redhat.

ken
